<@U0468JESVFY> asked
> How closely related are the life cycles of Widgets and Live Activities? What are their divergences?

elements.text: asked

elements.Raw: {"type":"rich_text_quote","elements":[{"type":"text","text":"How closely related are the life cycles of Widgets and Live Activities? What are their divergences?"}]}

slackdump_thread_replies.text:
They are very different.

Widgets are a timeline of preconstructed views.  We fetch the timeline and then show different entries from the timeline as time advances.  When we are told to reload a widget, or the timeline reaches its end, we will reload (depending on the widget's reload budget).

Activities are a single view.  When we receive an update for an activity we will hand the update to the appropriate extension and ask for an updated view.  We will only fetch a new view when we receive an update.  We do not budget activity reloads (although we do budget high-priority pushes that deliver some updates).

They are also very similar.

We will fetch updates for both widgets and activities if the UI environment changes: if the device switches locales, or font sizes, for example.

The lifecycles of the extension processes is the same for both widgets and activities.

Hi Michael,

Yes you can.
